sanskrit_verse:
न वृथा शपथं कुर्यात्स्वल्पेऽप्यर्थे नरो बुधः ।
वृथा हि शपथं कुर्वन् प्रेत्य चैह च नश्यति ॥ ८.१११॥
transliteration:
na vṛthā śapathaṁ kuryāt sv alpe 'py arthe naro budhaḥ |
vṛthā hi śapathaṁ kurvan pretya ca iha ca naśyati || 8.111||
sph_interpretive_translation: A wise person does not take an oath frivolously, even for a minor matter; one who takes an oath in vain perishes both in this life and the next.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority: The individual possesses the discriminative capacity to uphold or violate sacred utterance.
Causation: Frivolous oaths generate karmic disruption that leads to dissolution of integrity in both worlds.
Capacity-based responsibility: Only those with developed discernment are accountable for conscious misuse of declarative speech.
Restoration logic: Integrity must be restored through completion of truthful alignment, not punitive suffering.
Consciousness alignment: Sacred speech reflects inner alignment with Satya-Dharma; misalignment distorts reality.
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent declares誓词 AND context lacks substantive consequence THEN prohibit declaration
IF agent knowingly violates declarative truth THEN initiate consciousness-restoration protocol
IF oath taken without sankalpa (intentional resolve) THEN invalidate juridical weight
IF repeated frivolous declarations detected THEN activate integrity-reintegration sequence
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, any sworn testimony or affirmation must demonstrate sankalpa and contextual gravity. Oaths taken without conscious intent or for trivial matters shall be deemed invalid and subject to restorative judicial review rather than punitive contempt proceedings.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that verbal causality operates through conscious intention. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals that false or frivolous oaths disrupt sequential dharmic unfoldment. Responsibility is proportional to awareness, and restoration occurs through reintegration with truthful speech capacity, not punitive suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Individual repeats truthful declarations until vibrational alignment is restored.
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Individual publicly acknowledges misuse and commits to rectification.
Capacity Restoration: Training in mindful speech and sankalpa-based declaration practices.
Integrity Reintegration: Guided ritual and reflective practice to restore alignment between word, mind, and action.
final_declaration: This law proceeds from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority. Dharma is restored by aligning human speech with cosmic truth. Reality responds to consciousness, not punishment. All judgments derive from and return to the supremacy of awakened awareness.
